newsitem.title: BOSNIA: OSCE to postpone Bosnian polls, Western official.
newsitem.headline: OSCE to postpone Bosnian polls, Western official.

text.p: The international organisation in charge of Bosnia's polls has decided to postpone local elections scheduled for late November due to lack of cooperation by the parties, a Western official said on Tuesday.
"Municipal elections will be postponed later today because of political difficulties in all areas of the country," the official told reporters in Sarajevo on condition of anonymity.

Earlier diplomats said the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) was expected to announce within hours a decision to postpone controversial local elections in Bosnia until next spring.
"The OSCE is confident it can meet the logistical challenges but if it has the full support and cooperation of the parties," the Western official said in Sarajevo.
"(But) they are not confident of that support during the four weeks between now and the election day," he said.

The elections are viewed as the last chance for Bosnia to be reunited after a war that divided the country into ethnic ghettoes. Serbs have already said they will not take part, citing security problems in villages in Serb territory resettled by Moslem refugees.
